text: Earl Stephen Bishop (born November 14, 1951) is an American singer-songwriter, actor and guitarist. His biggest hits include "On and On", "It Might Be You" and "Save It for a Rainy Day". He has performed music in movies such as National Lampoon's Animal House, The China Syndrome, Roadie, Summer Lovers, Tootsie, White Nights, The Money Pit, The Boy Who Could Fly and All I Want for Christmas. Bishop was born in San Diego, California. Eric Clapton wrote in his autobiography that Bishop was one of his favorite singer-songwriters.Clapton, Eric (2007). Clapton: The Autobiography, p. 318. Crown, New York; On June 25, 2019, The New York Times Magazine listed Bishop with hundreds of other artists whose material was reportedly destroyed in the 2008 Universal Studios fire. ==References== ==Other websites== * * * Category:1951 births Category:Living people Category:Actors from San Diego Category:American movie actors Category:American rock guitarists Category:American rock singers Category:American television actors Category:Television personalities from California Category:Musicians from San Diego Category:Singer-songwriters from California Category:Writers from San Diego
title: Stephen Bishop (musician)
